instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that has no power.
I don't get green light or fan spin.

I have  3.32V on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
3.23V on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> 

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>:
2,73V <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>
2,72V Adapter sense
3.29V <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>

Already  tried with new charging port.

I imagine that the problem is related with this mesuarements (<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>). Am i correct? Can you help?

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
Is the SMC runing?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, without battery.

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
Hi,
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  oscilates in between 3.28V and 3.3V
Y5010 oscilates  in between 40 and 360kHz

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
You must get 12MHz at Y5010.
Post its DC voltages.
Check resistor, capacitors and traces.

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
It is oscilating between 0.5V and 0.9V

<SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL_R</SIGNAL> = 0.50V
<SIGNAL>SMC_EXTAL</SIGNAL> =  0.50V

Traces between <CAPACITOR>C5010</CAPACITOR> and <SIGNAL>SMC_EXTAL</SIGNAL> are OK, and btween <RESISTOR>R5010</RESISTOR> and <SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL_R</SIGNAL> also OK. <RESISTOR>R5010</RESISTOR> has 2.49 kohm to ground
Shall I replace Y5010?

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
Check power and signals for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2), page 45.
You may need to reball, or change SMC.

threads.title: 1278 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no grrenlight
threads.message:
You're right. It was a bad SMC.
TKS!
